title: Static IP for surfing via Wi-Fi
answer:
Settings > Wi-Fi, click the hot spot to be connected, and in the pop-up dialog box, check Show advanced options; in the IP settings, select Static, and fill out IP address (Most of the settings is 192.168.1.***), Gateway (Most of them are 192.168.1.1), Subnet prefix length and Domain name (dns address) in turn. 

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=110013) ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=110014)

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=110015)

 The biggest problem in using the Wi-Fi network is the failure to achieve the wait-free network connection, and it is a time-consuming job to obtain a dynamic IP address after connecting to a router. But you can realize rapid Internet access via Wi-Fi by with a static IP.
